IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE PALM SPRINGS ART MUSEUM CELEBRATES THE CREATIVE SPIRIT BY EXPLORING THE DYNAMIC WORLD OF THE ARTS WITH ITS COMMUNITIES AND VISITORS, IN THE AREAS OF ART, NATURAL SCIENCE AND PERFORMING ARTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE PALM SPRINGS ART MUSEUM CELEBRATES THE CREATIVE SPIRIT BY EXPLORING THE DYNAMIC WORLD OF THE ARTS WITH ITS COMMUNITIES AND VISITORS, IN THE AREAS OF ART AND PERFORMING ARTS.
IRS990.Description: Art ExhibitionsDuring the period October 2009 TO September 30, 2010, the museum presented the following temporary exhibitions in our galleries and conducted related educational programming:Selections from the Permanent Collection5/2 TO 11/29/2009Modern Moments: Recent Gifts in American Photography5/16 TO 11/8/2009The Passionate Pursuit: Gifts and Promised Works from Donna and Cargill MacMillan, Jr.9/5/2009 TO 8/1/2010Lino Tagliapietra in Retrospect: A Modern Renaissance in Italian Glass9/26 TO 12/27/2009Odyssey: The Photographs of Linda Connor12/12/09 TO 4/4/2010Between Earth and Heaven: The Architecture of John Lautner2/20 TO 5/30/2010Colors of the West: The Paintings of Birger Sandzen4/17 TO 9/12/2010Photographing the American West: Selections from the Permanent Collection6/12/2010 TO 2/27/2011

Activity2.Description: Performing Arts ProgramsThe Museums Annenberg Theater season featured a wide variety of music, theater, comedy, and dance performances, lecture presentations, and movies/film festivals. These events were presented by the museum and by outside community groups and producers. The museum also partners with the Palm Springs International Film Festival in January each year as one of the film screening venues. Menopause, The Musical came to the museum as an outside production with a very successful run from February 5-March 28. Performances during the 2009 TO 2010 season included:11/13/2009 Special Kaye, A Tribute to Kaye Ballard11/15/2009 Annenberg Theater Council Lecture - Rick McKay11/18/2009 Cabaret 88 Brent Barrett 11/28/2009 Melissa Manchester11/29/2009 Onstage Musicals 12/4/2009 An Evening of Opera12/5/2009 Palm Springs Opera Guild12/12/2009 The Diamonds12/13/2009 Desert Winds Freedom Band12/18/2009 David Arkenstone12/19/2009 Desert Dance Academy12/20/2009 Onstage Musicals1/21/2010 Cabaret 88 Ann Hampton Callaway 1/26/2010 Opera Showcase 1/28/2010 Jersey Girls1/29/2010 Lynda Carter2/5 TO 3/28/2010 Menopause, The Musical4/3/2010 Karen Akers4/6/2010 American Chamber Trio4/11/2010 Onstage Musicals5/14/2010 Cabaret 88 Alix Kory 4/20/2010 PBS Taping An Evening with Diahann Carroll4/21/2010 An Evening with Diahann Carroll 5/29/2010 San Gorgonio Ballet 6/19/2010 Crawford Dance Academy6/20/2010 Desert Dance Academy

Activity3.Description: EDUCATION - During the past year, the Museum frequently partnered with Coachella Valley school districts and colleges, public libraries, and local city governments, and we hosted Community Days free of charge every Thursday in conjunction with the weekly VillageFest/Street Fair in downtown Palm Springs, which often includes free film screenings. A Free 2nd Sundays program was launched in October 2009. On the second Sunday of every month, the Museum offers special family activities and films in addition to its regular exhibitions. On October 30, the Museum hosted its annual Dia de los Muertos/Day of the Dead Celebration which attracted 5,400 visitors on that single day.Adult Education Programs benefited approximately 26,000 attendees. In addition to docent-led tours of the galleries and special exhibitions, adults participated in art workshops in drawing, painting, printmaking and mixed media; evening lectures in the Annenberg Theater and weekend symposia; free community days, and outreach programs.Youth Program attendance in the 2010 fiscal year included approximately 18,000 students and children who participated in free school tours geared to specific age levels and curricula, childrens education programs, free community days, and who visited the museum with their family or to complete school assignments.Specialized Museum education programs serving youth this past year were:KidStudio Projects (an after-school program for children in grades 1-6). Museum Art Camp (for youngsters 3 TO 12). Eyes On/Hands On (specialized 1-hour docent-led tour of the museum galleries followed by a related hands on art project in our studio classrooms). Writing in the Museum (docent-guided tour of specific artworks, followed by descriptive, reflective, and analytical writing exercises). Teen Docent/TeenStudio Projects programs (academic extra-curricular enrichment activity for high school students). Zone 101 (an interactive gallery space for children and their families).

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Consistent with the standards of the Museum profession and the policies of the Museum's Board of Trustees, the collections of the Museum are not recorded as assets on the financial statements, as the Museum does not attempt to determine the fair market value of the collection. The values noted above reflect the cost of purchases or the appraised value supplied by the donor at the time that works were gifted to the Museum. This record reflects the collection's historic valuation and is adjusted when deaccessioning occurs and/or when new works are added to the collection.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ONCE THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN RECEIVED THE BOARD MEMBERS WILL REVIEW FOR ANY POTENTIAL CHANGES. IF NO CHANGES ARE REQUIRED THEN THE ORGANIZATION WHILE HAVE THE FORM FILED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MUSEUM REQUIRES ALL DIRECTORS TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES (PERSONNEL COMMITTEE) EXECUTE THE DUTIES DESCRIBED ON LINE 15 AND ARE RECORDED IN THE MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE AND THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WHO APPROVE THEIR RECOMMENDATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DOCUMENTS ARE LOCATED IN THE FRONT OFFICE WHERE ANYBODY CAN REQUEST A COPY OF THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND THEY WILL BE PROVIDED TO THEM.
THE ORGANIZATION DOES HAVE AN AUDIT COMMITTEE THAT HOLDS MEETINGS BEFORE AND AFTER THE AUDIT TO ENSURE IT IS COMPLETED IN A TIMELY MANNER.
